metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15098 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
drivers/net/wireless/ath/ath6kl/usb.c in the Linux kernel through 5.2.9 has a NULL pointer dereference via an incomplete address in an endpoint descriptor. Hui Peng discovered that the Atheros AR6004 USB Wi-Fi device driver for the Linux kernel did not properly validate endpoint descriptors returned by the device. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15098` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1058-aws - 4.4.0-1058.62
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-168-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1058.62').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1').
